I installed Ubuntu under Wubi from Windows XP. is it possible to boot my windows partition inside a virtual machine from within Ubuntu using a virtual machine? should I use virtualbox or qemu?
the problem is the filesystem access would become really complicated... You can do it if you have a standard install of Ubuntu, in its own partition
why can't I just point it at the partition all the same? windows isn't going to do anything to my loopback file
obviously, if it did, it would cause mayhem
you're running Linux off your active windows partition - you can't then use Linux to mount the windows partiton in a VM, because Linux is using it
but the VM doesn't "mount" the partition, it does raw access to the device, no?
there wouldn't be any point in the VM "mounting" it, because it wouldn't be able to do anything raw to the disk
for example, the virtual bios wouldn't know how to read the mbr
its not a case of mbrs and bios, its a case of locking the partition
I'm convinced that vmware used to be able to do it when I used it years ago.
